availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alonzo Keith (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Harrison County, Kentucky, native. Son of John D. Keith and Mary Ann Keith. Married to Mary Frances King Keith in Pendleton County on December 22, 1859. Father of Alfred D. Keith. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Private in the 18th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from February 8, 1862, to February 6, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 366B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 25.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994052, Pendleton County Marriages, p. 275-276.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 4.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7020619, Harrison County Deaths, file #14592.
Find A Grave, "Alonzo Keith (January 8, 1837-February 6, 1863)," Memorial #74823279, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/74823279 (accessed June 5, 2018).
